title: 111_hr4244
content: The "Small Business Research and Experimentation Simplification Act of 2009" may be cited as the "Small Business Research Credit" under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Business Research Credit" allows eligible small businesses to claim a tax credit of 20% of qualified research expenses. An eligible small business is defined as an employer with an average of 500 or fewer employees during the preceding calendar year. Qualified research expenses exclude land but include tangible property. The tax credit for small businesses is based on the average number of employees in the preceding calendar year or the expected number for the current year. The credit amount is limited by the regular tax liability and other credits available for that taxable year. The credit amount is limited by the regular tax liability and other credits available for that taxable year. The aggregate credits allowed to a taxpayer under subpart C can be increased by 25 percent of the excess of the regular tax liability plus the tax imposed by section 55 over the credit allowable under subsection (a). The tax credit for small businesses is limited by the regular tax liability and other credits available for the taxable year. Special rules apply, including treating controlled groups as a single person and denying double benefits. The amount taken into account under subsection (a) shall not be considered for deductions or credits under this chapter. The basis of property eligible for the credit is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed. Special rules apply for individuals with interests in unincorporated businesses, partnerships, estates or trusts, and S corporations. The tax credit for small businesses is limited by the regular tax liability and other credits available for the taxable year. The amount determined under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed an amount equal to the tax attributable to the person's taxable income allocable to their interest in the trade or business. Subsection (a) does not apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015. Conforming amendments are made to sections 24(b)(3)(B), 25(e)(1)(C)(ii), and 25A(i)(5)(B) of the Code. Sections 25B(g)(2), 26(a)(1), 904(i), and 1400C(d)(2) of the Code are amended to include new provisions. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code. The Comptroller General, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, will submit a report to the Committees on Small Business regarding the simplified small business research credit under section 30E of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by June 30, 2015.
